Activity: Arrive at office, check emails, and review the progress on the technical specification document and chosen integration approach.
Start working on the Proof of Concept (POC). Focus on establishing a connection to the EHR system and extracting a small sample of influenza-related data.
Troubleshoot any connection issues or data extraction errors. Consult with @ehrv-1 if necessary (ideally through vendor's online portal/FAQ).
Transform the extracted data into the standardized format required for the influenza trend analysis.
Load the transformed data into the database and verify its accuracy. Loaf around browsing the internet.
Lunch Break. Catch up on personal news.
Document the steps involved in the POC, including code snippets, configuration settings, and any challenges encountered.

Share the POC results with @qatest-1 (Quality Assurance Tester) and @da-1 (Data Analyst) to obtain their feedback on data quality and accuracy. @PEOPLE: qatest-1, da-1; Topic: POC Results and Data Quality Feedback
Address any issues or concerns raised by @qatest-1 and @da-1. Refine the data transformation process as needed.
Prepare a final report summarizing the POC results, including recommendations for next steps and potential improvements.
Submit the final report to @itpm-1 and @clinlead-1. Check emails one last time and wrap up the week.
